intro: Trigonia nivea var. candida, commonly known as the white-flowered trigonia, is a striking member of the Acanthaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in terminal clusters, adding a delicate beauty to gardens. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, white powdery coating, giving it a unique appearance. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. This ornamental plant is popular in tropical and subtropical regions for its aesthetic appeal and relatively easy care requirements.
